section.label: A.2.1
section.title: CR Image IOD Description
section.para: The Computed Radiography (CR) Image Information Object Definition specifies an image that has been created by a computed radiography imaging device.

note.para: Digital Luminescence Radiography is an equivalent term for computed Radiography.

section.label: A.2.2
section.title: CR Image IOD Entity-Relationship Model
section.para: This IOD uses the E-R Model in, with only the Image IE below the Series IE. The Frame of Reference IE is not a component of this IOD.

section.label: A.2.3
section.title: CR Image IOD Module Table
section.para: specifies the Modules of the CR Image IOD.

td.para: C - Required if contrast media was used in this image

note.para:
The
was previously included in the Image IE for this IOD but has been retired. See PS3.3-2004.

section.label: A.3.1
section.title: CT Image IOD Description
section.para: The Computed Tomography (CT) Image Information Object Definition (IOD) specifies an image that has been created by a computed tomography imaging device.

section.label: A.3.2
section.title: CT Image IOD Entity-Relationship Model
section.para: This IOD uses the E-R Model in, with only the Image IE below the Series IE.

section.label: A.3.3
section.title: CT Image IOD Module Table
section.para: specifies the Modules of the CT Image IOD.

td.para: C - Required if time synchronization was applied.
C - Required if contrast media was used in this image
C - Required if Multi-energy CT Acquisition (0018,9361) is YES.

section.label: A.3.3.1
section.title: CT Image IOD Content Constraints
section.para: If Multi-energy CT Acquisition (0018,9361) is YES the following constraints will apply:

listitem.para:
The
shall be present if contrast was administered even if images are processed to remove contrast information from the pixels, e.g. Virtual Non-Contrast images.
The Real World Value Mapping Sequence (0040,9096) shall be present in the.

For Measurement Units Code Sequence (0040,08EA) in the Real World Value Mapping Sequence (0040,9096) D
shall be used.

section.label: C.2
section.title: Patient Modules
section.para: The following Sections specify Modules used for Patient management.

section.label: C.2.1
section.title: Patient Relationship Module
section.para: specifies the Attributes of the, which reference SOP Instances related to this SOP Class.

td.para: Uniquely identifies the Study SOP Instances associated with the Patient SOP Instance. One or more Items shall be included in this Sequence.
Uniquely identifies the Visit SOP Instances associated with this Patient SOP Instance. One or more Items shall be included in this Sequence.
Uniquely identifies any Patient SOP Instances that also describe this Patient. These SOP Instances are aliases. Zero or more Items shall be included in this Sequence.

section.label: C.2.2
section.title: Patient Identification Module
section.para: specifies the Attributes of the, which define the Attributes relevant to identifying a Patient.

note.para: In the case of imaging a group of small animals simultaneously, the single value of this identifier corresponds to the identification of the entire group. See also.

td.para: The type of identifier in the Patient ID (0010,0020).

listitem.para: The identifier is coded as a string regardless of the type, not as a binary value.
When this Attribute has a value of BARCODE, Patient ID (0010,0020) may or may not have the same value as Barcode Value (2200,0005) in the, if present.

td.para: A Sequence of identification numbers or codes used to identify the Patient, which may or may not be human readable, and may or may not have been obtained from an implanted or attached device such as an RFID or barcode.
One or more Items are permitted in this Sequence.

note.para: This Attribute replaces the use of Other Patient IDs (0010,1000), which did not specify an issuer for each other identifier, and which has been retired.

td.para: The type of identifier in the Patient ID (0010,0020) in this Item.

listitem.para: The identifier is coded as a string regardless of the type, not as a binary value.
When this Attribute has a value of BARCODE, Patient ID (0010,0020) may or may not have the same value as Barcode Value (2200,0005) in the, if present.

td.para: Other names used to identify the Patient.
A photo to confirm the identity of a Patient.
Only a single Item is permitted in this Sequence.

note.para: Previously, Other Patient IDs (0010,1000) and Medical Record Locator (0010,1090) were included in this table. These Attributes have been retired. See PS3.3-2017a.

section.label: C.2.2.1.1
section.title: Referenced Patient Photo Sequence
section.para: A Patient Photo may be provided as an additional means to confirm the identity of the Patient.

When the Referenced SOP Sequence (0008,1199) is present, the Referenced SOP Class UID (0008,1150) shall be either VL Photographic Image Storage (1.2.840.10008.5.1.4.1.1.77.1.4) or Secondary Capture Image Storage (1.2.840.10008.5.1.4.1.1.7).

When the WADO Retrieval Sequence (0040,E023) or WADO-RS Retrieval Sequence (0040,E025) is present, the Retrieve URI (0040,E010) shall refer to a JPEG image if the referenced server is not WADO-compliant.
